common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS after upgrading to version 11.0.4.  Problems include "Route not found" errors and "Connection refused" messages when accessing the Pieces OS endpoint.  Troubleshooting steps include verifying the correct port (39300) and providing detailed information about the user's project and environment.

related_issues.title: Getting an error of Route not found error
related_issues.text:
Getting an error of Route not found error
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The problem "route not found" appears whenever I attempt to access the pieces os endpoint on port 39300.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4f8961a-afa1-401d-82b5-cc2ead804b9f)
## GitHub Issue Summary: 
**Title:** 
* Not provided in the context. 

**Author:** 
* Raju-git20

**Date:** 
* 2025-01-25

**Key Points:**

* User Raju-git20 reported an issue and received an automatic response from the Pieces support bot.
* The bot acknowledged the issue, provided estimated response time, and offered relevant resources.
* The bot suggested checking similar issues and documentation for potential solutions.

**Problems Identified:** 
* The specific problem Raju-git20 faced is not mentioned in the context. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** 
* No solutions are proposed or implemented in this conversation. 

**Current Status/Outcome:** 
* The issue is acknowledged and routed to the appropriate team member. 
* Raju-git20 is expected to receive a follow-up within 24 hours. 

**Additional Notes:** 
* The bot provided links to resources that might help Raju-git20 troubleshoot the issue.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Point:** Raju-git20 is experiencing issues connecting to PiecesOS after the upgrade to version 11.0.0.

**Problem:** Raju's attempt to connect using the new port (39300) was unsuccessful, as shown in the provided screenshots.

**Proposed Solution:** mark-at-pieces suggests discussing the problem further and learning more about Raju's project.

**Current Status:** The issue remains unresolved and requires further investigation.

**Next Steps:**

* Raju should provide more details about their project and environment.
* mark-at-pieces can then assist with troubleshooting and identifying the root cause of the connection issue.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Issue Summary: Unable to Open Pieces Core Services

**Key Points Raised:**

* ThemePark encountered an issue where they are unable to open Pieces Core Services.
* The issue was reported to the Pieces support bot.

**Problems Identified:**

* The root cause of the issue was unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support bot automatically triaged the issue and suggested related issues and resources for troubleshooting.
* Mack from Pieces asked clarifying questions to gather further information about the issue.
* ThemePark provided details about their Windows version and installation of Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ended without a resolution or confirmation of the issue being resolved. It's unclear if the problem persisted. 
* Additional information and troubleshooting may be required to reach a resolution.

common_issues.title: Copilot Not Responding or Showing Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Copilot not generating code, getting stuck loading, or displaying errors like "Something went wrong with processing.". This might be related to OpenAI API keys, local SSL certificates, or specific LLM models. Suggested workarounds include removing API keys, trying different LLMs (like GPT4o), updating Pieces OS, or signing in for higher rate limits. The Pieces team is actively investigating the root cause.

related_issues.title: Copilot is not giving any feedback
related_issues.text:
Copilot is not giving any feedback
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 3.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The copilot is not generating anything, it just keeps on loading.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User `gittydia` reported an issue with Claude 3.5 Copilot's response.
* The issue appeared to be related to the "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with the processing..." error message.
* Support bot suggested similar issues and resources while routing the issue to the relevant team.
* Developer `mark-at-pieces` initially suggested a fix in PiecesOS release 11.0.4.
* Another user, `luigigalli`, reported the same issue despite being on the mentioned version.
* User `luigigalli` confirmed the issue persisted after trying different LLMs and reinstalling the latest stable version.

**Problems Identified:**

* Claude 3.5 Copilot was experiencing response issues.
* The initial fix in PiecesOS 11.0.4 did not resolve the problem for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* PiecesOS release 11.0.4 was suggested as a fix.
* Uninstalling and reinstalling the latest stable version was recommended.
* A real-time debugging session was proposed to further investigate the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved for some users even after the proposed solutions.
* A real-time debugging session is scheduled to further diagnose the problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue has been reported by multiple users.
* Staging builds are discouraged due to potential instability.
* The conversation highlights the importance of user feedback and real-time collaboration in resolving issues.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of Github Issue Conversation

### Key Points:
* Users reported encountering the "Something went wrong with processing" error while using Pieces with GPT-4, Claude or Gemini.
* The issue was related to invalidated OpenAI API keys and a potential problem with local SSL certificates.

### Problems:

* Users were unable to use GPT-4, Claude or Gemini due to the "Something went wrong with processing" error.

### Solutions:
* **Short Term:**
    * Removing OpenAI API keys.
    * Switching to the GPT4o model.
    * Updating Pieces to version 11.0.3.
    * Signing in to Pieces to benefit from higher rate limits.
    * Trying alternative LLMs like OpenAI models if issues persist.
* **Long Term:**
    * Investigating the root cause of the issue with local SSL certificates.

### Current Status:
* The cause of the issue with local SSL certificates is still under investigation.
* Users can use GPT4o as a workaround.

## Conclusion
It appears that users were facing an issue with using particular LLM models due to OpenAI API key issues and a potential problem with their local SSL certificates. While there are some temporary fixes available, the development team is actively investigating to provide a permanent solution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties installing Pieces OS on Windows and Linux, encountering errors related to app installers, Windows Defender blocks, and missing dependencies. Solutions include adding Pieces OS to Defender exclusions, troubleshooting installer issues, and addressing dependency conflicts. Connection problems to Pieces OS from external projects are also frequent, requiring further investigation and potential port configuration.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Ollama installation fails when using Pieces-OS as a snap due to missing `curl` command in the sandbox environment.
* Installing Ollama manually or globally has no effect as Pieces-OS cannot access external executables.

**Problems Identified:**

* Miscommunication about package confinement (strict vs. classic) within Pieces-OS.
* Ollama installation fails due to missing `curl` dependency.
* Solution using global installation or snap confinement is not possible.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Patch the package to allow Ollama usage from within the sandbox.
* Add `curl` to the list of dependency packages in the snap definition file.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Fix is currently in development and targeted for release within the next week.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue persists in the latest version of Pieces-OS as of January 23, 2025.
* The contributor has been informed of the delay and the upcoming fix.

related_issues.title: suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)
related_issues.text:
suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

n/a

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

suite installer always fails for me. (windows 11)

```
  shane @ moa ❯ ~ cd .\Downloads\
  shane @ moa ❯ Downloads ./Pieces_Suite.appinstaller
ResourceUnavailable: Program 'Pieces_Suite.appinstaller' failed to run: An error occurred trying to start process 'C:\Users\shane\Downloads\Pieces_Suite.appinstaller' with working directory 'C:\Users\shane\Downloads'. The app didn't start.At line:1 char:1
+ ./Pieces_Suite.appinstaller
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~.
  shane @ moa ❯ Downloads
```


also tried double clicking in gui. same issue>

I also tried as user and admin

all failed
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Windows installation via App Installer is problematic.
* Possible solutions include updating App Installer and restarting the PC.
* User installed via EXE but encountered application not starting.
* The issue was Windows Defender blocking the application.
* Adding the application directory to Windows Defender exclusions resolved the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Difficulty installing via App Installer.
* Application not starting after successful EXE installation.
* Windows Defender blocking the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Updating App Installer and restarting the PC.
* Adding the application directory to Windows Defender exclusions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user was able to successfully install and run the application after adding the application directory to Windows Defender exclusions.
* Further investigation is planned to determine the cause of Windows Defender blocking the application and potentially update documentation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place between April 2024 and January 2025.
* The specific version of the application is v9.

I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any further questions.

common_issues.title: Copilot UI and Response Errors
common_issues.description: Users report large font sizes in the Pieces Copilot interface, particularly on Linux. Additionally, some users experience unresponsive Copilot behavior with a 'Something went wrong with processing' error. Suggested solutions include adjusting zoom settings, updating Pieces OS, and verifying OpenAI API keys. The development team is actively investigating these issues.

related_issues.title: The interface's font is too large.
related_issues.text:
The interface's font is too large.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The recent interface update, specifically the increased font size in the answer section, limits the number of answers that can be displayed. 
![Screenshot from 2024-07-12 22-14-57](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3265af50-ffc6-4ab1-b6b8-397cd3979a9f)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The Pieces Copilot app is experiencing UI issues, including large font sizes and an inability to zoom within the onboarding screens.
* Scaling/resolution/font size adjustments on user systems may be impacting the app's sizing.
* Onboarding screens should allow for zooming for accessibility and consistency purposes.

**Problems Identified:**

* Larger font sizes than desired in the Pieces Copilot app.
* Onboarding screens lack zoom functionality.
* Clicking on the chat window prevents zooming in the chat area.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Users can adjust zoom within the desktop app using "Ctrl+" or "Ctrl-".
* Update to version 3.1.0 of the Desktop App was released to address UI issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The reported issues appear to be ongoing, with users still experiencing large font sizes and zooming difficulties.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be particularly impactful on high-resolution displays and for users with specific accessibility needs.

**Recommendations:**

* Further investigation and development efforts are needed to address the reported UI issues and improve the overall user experience.

common_issues.title: Pieces Suite Installation and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties installing Pieces Suite on Windows, encountering errors with App Installer and Windows Defender blocking the application. Solutions include updating App Installer, adding Pieces to Defender exclusions, and troubleshooting network connectivity issues with Pieces OS, potentially related to port changes in recent updates.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Point:** Raju-git20 is experiencing issues connecting to PiecesOS after the upgrade to version 11.0.0.

**Problem:** Raju's attempt to connect using the new port (39300) was unsuccessful, as shown in the provided screenshots.

**Proposed Solution:** mark-at-pieces suggests discussing the problem further and learning more about Raju's project.

**Current Status:** The issue remains unresolved and requires further investigation.

**Next Steps:**

* Raju should provide more details about their project and environment.
* mark-at-pieces can then assist with troubleshooting and identifying the root cause of the connection issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize connection issues:** Allocate more resources to investigate and resolve the root causes of 'Pieces OS Connection Issues' and 'Pieces OS Installation and Connection Issues', especially focusing on port configurations and compatibility with different operating systems and project setups.

**Address Copilot errors:** Dedicate a team to tackle the recurring 'Copilot Not Responding or Showing Errors' and 'Copilot UI and Response Errors'. Investigate OpenAI API key issues, local SSL certificate conflicts, and explore alternative LLM options for improved stability.

**Improve installation experience:** Review and refine the installation processes for both Pieces OS and Pieces Suite, addressing issues with App Installer, Windows Defender conflicts, and missing dependencies. Provide clear and updated documentation for a smoother user experience.

**Gather more data on UI issues:** While 'Copilot UI and Response Errors' are acknowledged, actively collect more user feedback on specific UI problems, particularly large font sizes on Linux. This will help prioritize and address UI/UX improvements effectively.

**Proactive communication:** Keep users informed about the status of known issues, especially those with ongoing investigations like Copilot errors and connection problems. Provide clear timelines for fixes and workarounds to manage expectations and reduce support ticket volume.
